  9789. I got my husband a new set, and it was just a disappointment when this is his favorite brand and swears by the name.
  9790. Since I'm cutting my own hair these days, I wanted something that was easy enough for self use as well as for my significant other to use if she is cutting my hair.
  9791. Blue grip area feels nice; less slick than other parts<br /><br
  9792. The colored plastic clippers are comfortable to use though a little tight going on and off.
  9793. After cutting hair for 4+ people, I'd really rather putting it away to be easy.
  9794. I didn't really take the color coding into consideration when buying this, but when I was scrambling around for the different sizes, it made it easier than the typical search for number.<br />I
  9795. I've had previous Wahl products last much longer before the rust showed up.
  9796. My old Wahl was about worn out and this set was less than the cost of repairing the old one.
  9797. She likes it because I get hit on less, which is approaching absolute zero.
  9798. Being that everything besides the clipper is plastic and in a tiny space, it is easy for thing to bounce around and get broken.
  9799. it is very noisy that I couldn't use it ,when i tight the screw it doesn't work ?
  9800. Only drawback is that if you have a lot of hair to be cutting with this, the blades seem to start to yank some hair once they're hot from consecutive uses (the oil it comes with helps though, kind of messy to apply).
  9801. I am new at cutting hair, but have used multiple razors now and this one is the easiest and most sturdy quality.
  9802. The blade itself has a small amount of adjustability and that is enough for me to set the right length of trim which is enough to give me a stubble look.
  9803. Due to the reasonable price, favorable reviews, and high ratings, I went ahead and ordered this Wahl kit from Amazon and it arrived in a few days.<br
  9804. The previous Wahl I had experienced would have the power switch get jammed or work weird, but that was after two years of use and being dropped all the time (wasn't me
  9805. The trimmer with the array of adapters with different colour codes really made hair cutting easy for my boys.
  9806. We’ve bought multiple clippers from local department stores and paid twice as much for them an in the end, they cut half as well as the Wahl Color Pro
  9807. Clippers work fine, just the case hinges are both broken.
  9808. that oil does not clean off very well.
  9809. and I like the color coding ,but the generic case makes it hard to fit everything in it, and impossible to make case content neat and tidy.
  9810. then used the #7, and #6, clippers to shorten the back, and clear off some loose ends.
  9811. />First time I ordered this item, most of the guards were loose in the case and broken.
  9812. The shaver itself is pretty heavy and comes with a decent length cord and the blades are adjustable with the little lever.
  9813. As I mentioned, with all the positive reviews, I can only suppose that I was unlucky to say the least, however with differences in packaging and the ridiculously loud noise omitted by this clipper set
  9814. Two things I warn a parent of a little boy against is to avoid the 1/4 inch or shorter combs and avoid the ear trim combs until you really know what you're doing, cuz I cut off a little but too much hair with these two combs (where you can see through to his skin).
  9815. A little bit too much niosy
  9816. ;, the jump from the number 1 guard to the number 2 is a little too much for the adjustment built in to the clippers.
  9817. Storage is very compact and fits in closet with little space used.
  9818. other then that for the price and the way it cuts its an over all deal i can live with.
  9819. It's sturdy, tough, and cheap.
  9820. A bit awkward to keep changing Left and Right sides, but, hey, if you get the right results, and you did not empty your bank account when you bought this hair-cutting device, then you are a winner!<br />My
  9821. Pop off the attachment and blow a little compressed air on the blades, put a drop of oil on them and you're ready for your next buzz!
  9822. Unit paid for itself the very first trim and no more waiting around or dealing with long hair!
  9823. We'd been using some Wal-Mart brand clipper that I paid $12 for until it got to be so dull and temperamental that it was no longer worth
  9824. I cut my two boy's hair, ages 6 and 9 and needed a new set of clippers due to the others starting to become unreliable.
  9825. When this one came though it was obviously used, the guides, combs and other accessories were all new though.<br /><br
  9826. comfortable, only a little heavy.
  9827. It cuts as close or as far away as you want and really have had no issues with dull blades or anything of the sort.
  9828. I really did not realize how dull my old ones were.
  9829. Super heavy and sharp.
  9830. recommend this product to anyone, it has really saved us money and will continue to down the road!
  9831. Very loud compared to my other Wahl.
  9832. Also the Bottom blade was uneven upon arrival so that had to re-adjusted to make level with the top blade which wasn't hard but just wanted to not that for both the seller and the potential buyers.<br />They
  9833. To heavy, hard to handle is a &#34;vibrater&#34;, OK for the price, but I definitely won't be using it.
  9834. &#34;Buyer beware&#34;, these clippers are high quality and sharp!
  9835. Only after using it for a couple of times, now it makes a very loud noise and vibrates extremely to the point that cut the skin.
  9836. Used this on numerous occasions up high.... and down below.
  9837. Since I keep my hair very short, this high quality Wahl clipper with a #8 attachment lets me to go town on my head to cut it down to proper length every time.
  9838. Although a little heavy, this hair cutter is very powerful.
  9839. I loved it, I read some bad reviews and almost didn't buy it

All Reviews

  4. It works very well. I love it!
  5. I just cut my own hair with it haha. Worked as intended.<br /><br />It is a bit messy or clusterful with all the different sizes.   6. Needs very little maintenance, going very strong.
  7.   26. I just wanted a cheap, powerful, dependable clipper to use when I cut my own hair, and, even though I've only used it once, I'm impressed with this set so far. I was surprised by how bulky and heavy it felt when I first picked it up, but I don't think this is a bad thing, it makes the clippers feel more high quality. That said, if you have small hands or are looking for something with a small form factor, this probably isn't the product for you.<br /><br />The included booklets about how to use the color-coded clipper guards to get different looks are nice, but I didn't really need those. I usually just put on the smallest guard (in this case 1/8&#34;) and buzz my whole head. I have very thick hair so I've had a lot of problems in the past with clippers getting bogged down, but these sheared my entire head completely effortlessly.<br /><br />They're big, sure, but they're also very powerful and I can see the color coded sizes being very useful to people looking to give themselves more complex cuts. If you're like me and you just buzz your entire head, they work wonders for that too.

  67. 100% Grade A Chinese piece of s***. Made of the thinnest plastic possible, for profits sake of course. The attachments are just as s****, a few will be broken almost immediately due to being made of paper thing plastic. Works fantastic for about a week. If you have kids or a rowdy household, I recommend NOT buying this, it has the built quality of a porcelain doll. As with other reviewers, drop this thing in the sink from 6 inches away is enough to make this thing explode into dozens of plastic bits. Very easy to do, as this is a hefty set of trimmers with substantial weight to it. Had to use tweezers to get the splinters of plastic out of my hand after only a drop of six inches. The five star reviews come from people who have either used it once and wrote a review, work for the company selling this trash, or are just dumb consumers who refuse to know any different. I had it for three months and I might as well have gotten a single haircut at great s****, i mean clips.

  88. Hi, I didn't get a haircut for over 2 months. HOLY MOLY - I literally cut OFF square INCHES of hair!!!<br /><br />And then I tried the RIGHT side tapering tool, and then the LEFT tapering tool. Not too bad, but I DO NOT RECOMMEND doing this until you get a bit more practice.<br /><br />I then used the #7, and #6, clippers to shorten the back, and clear off some loose ends. The final result is of course not professional salon quality, however it does result in a reasonably good SELF haircut!!!<br /><br />This clipper allows you to SAVE $20 per haircut, and going months without even getting a haircut, so it essentially PAYS FOR ITSELF AFTER ONLY ONE USE!<br /><br />If you get REALLY GOOD at doing it yourself, or your girlfriend learns how to use it on you, you can literally save $1000s over a lifetime in haircuts!

  186. Wahl trimmers are great- it makes literally no sense for me to go to a stylist when these trimmers cost less than a single cut.<br /><br />First, I should comment on the build quality- this clipper is built like a tank. It's heavy in your hands. The motor sounds like a small lawnmower. Because it is corded, you don't have to worry about the battery weakening and dying. I am repurchasing after 2 years, only because I lost my old one when I moved. Other than that, I can't imagine this clipper breaking or malfunctioning for want of build quality.<br /><br />There are also nice little touches- the carrying case and color-coded hair trimming guides, for instance. The color-codes are fool-proof, and the carrying case keeps the whole thing organized. The price for this clipper is just nuts- I have no idea how Wahl turns a profit. In short, this is an easy decision if you're thinking about cutting your own hair (particularly if you want a simple haircut).<br /><br />One small note- invest in a stylist's apron to catch the hair. It will mess up your clothes otherwise!

Having not read the directions well, I did make some mistakes, but his hair actually turned out really well for the first time, so I think it will be perfect next time! Two things I warn a parent of a little boy against is to avoid the 1/4 inch or shorter combs and avoid the ear trim combs until you really know what you're doing, cuz I cut off a little but too much hair with these two combs (where you can see through to his skin). But I used the number 3 (3/8 inch) on the bottom of his hair, number 4 (1/2 inch around the middle) and the number 7 (7/8 inch) on the top of his hair, and I had to use the scissors to trim his bangs shorter...and I really liked it! It also gives me a little sense of accomplishment knowing I can cut his hair myself and that I can save money too! You can't go wrong trying this out because even if you only use it a couple times, it pays for itself!<br /><br />The only thing I'm still not sure about is, am I supposed to use this when my son's hair is wet or dry? :)<br /><br />Edit: coming back to this over a year later, I still love this. The last time I cut my son's hair, family members thought he went to a salon. It has been nice to do it myself and save the money and the hassle of going to a salon. It still works like new!a salon. It still works like new!

  207. I have to get my hair cut once a week so I usually shave my head to save time and money . The clipper worked pretty good at first. I have fine hair and it cut through it with no problems. Plenty of power and it has not slowed down over time. Blades are plenty sharp and have stayed sharp. No complains about the noise and I never noticed much heat coming off it. The design is fairly ergonomic and I can reach the back of my head with no problem. I never use the guards so no comment on them. After 6 months or so I started to have problems with the vibrating mechanism. It seems that the plastic vibrator comes off the bottom blade causing to to not vibrate properly/fully. This started happening more and more frequently and now, a year later, I find myself fussing the the blades to make sure it vibrates correctly every time I cut my hair. It was good while it lasted, but now its time to replace it. Bottom Line: It's a capable hair clipper for a great price. Durability is its only limitation but what can you expect for $20. I give it a lifespan of 25 cuts.

Best buzzer I've ever owned.<br />Which I may be damning with feint praise since the only other one I had was a rechargeable remmington buzzer that went a bit funky.<br />But this thing cuts fast and nice, doesn't tug hair and feels powerful from the moment you turn it on.<br /><br />As others have mentioned, the plastic spacers that come with it feel really flimsy. They feel like they could snap at any moment but plastic is tricky like that, they could be plenty okay and honestly they're not going through that much 'abuse' so I wager they'll be fine.<br /><br />The scissors that come with this?   239. Cutting my family's hair now great item
  240. Just bought these myself to replace a set of old, cheap electromagnetic clippers - and the difference is night and day. These are much more solid, much more powerful, and much quicker to do their job than the others. This is the same mechanism in Wahl's other home-grade clippers - a traditional rotating electric motor driving the shears by gears and levers - NOT a simple oscillating magnetic field coil coaxing a plastic arm back and forth as the A/C current reverses at 60Hz. You can't stop these blades without stalling a rotating motor - which means even the thickest hair is going to be cut easily - I suspect it would go through fine copper wire just as well (although that won't improve your blades' condition). That wasn't the case toward the end of my cheaper model's life. These are the least expensive motor driven clippers I've found anywhere, and so far they are great value for money. My package actually claims to be made in the USA, so bonus for those who are making an effort to bolster domestic products. These are not top-of-the-line commercial hair cutting equipment, but considering that they cost less than 2 cheap gentlemen's haircuts, I think you can find very little to complain about with this set of clippers.
  241. The bang for your buck! Built to last a lifetime! Blades are sharp. Will save on haircuts!
  242. I bought this kit to replace a Wahl \\"Designer\\" which developed a problem after about 10 years of home haircutting and would have cost more to fix than this kit cost as a replacement.<br /><br />The clipper is quiet and works well. It gives the impression of a lot of power in reserve, and doesn't heat up in the hand. I was pleasantly surprised by the left and right angled guide combs used for the ears, which are included in the kit. They made that part of the haircut really easy. After years of cutting my hair with only the straight guide combs that came with my old clippers, I didn't think I would use them, but I tried them once and I'm very happy I did. They're great, and if you bought them separately, they would go for about half the price of the kit, making the kit a bargain.<br /><br />The clipper itself is intended for home use and feels like it, unlike my old one, which felt a bit more heavy-duty. But this one does as good a job of cutting my hair, and costs about half as much. If it lasts half as long as the old ones did, I'll be more than satisfied.<br /><br />Editing to update after a little over four years (probably about 40 haircuts, although I haven't kept an actual count): The clipper is still going strong, without any problem.

My wife and I started doing trims with a Wahl just to shorten the periods between shop visits and it slowly eliminated those visits as our experience and skill level grew. Now that we’re out of those working environments and living in the high desert a quick buzz cut every month during the summer is all that’s needed and it reduces the amount of shampoo needed and just makes for a much cooler and more comfortable way to make it through those long hot summers. We’re also about 40-miles from a town so self-cutting is pretty much the only way to go. This is a nice kit but we don’t use most of the attachments. The motor assembly is the heart of it and it’s just as good as the vintage one it replaced… which will get an overhaul and become a backup clipper. I see no reason for anything less than 5-stars but some may not like how hard it is to get all those pieces back into the case. We also like that the cutting edge never heats up to be uncomfortable. Keep it oiled and it should give many years of service and it’s even a few bucks less than I paid in August 2013.

  255. This is a great quality hair clipper, but it also makes quick work of titanium based facial hair (you know, that facial hair that appears to be constructed of some form of alien element which would require six new razors for one shave). Those who only shave occasionally such as long haul drivers, oil rig drillers and derricks, government agents on long stakeouts, etc. will find these invaluable as it can take a full beard to close shave in a matter of minutes as opposed to the hour long ordeal normally required with a razor.<br />By using the shortest attachment on the face, you can then remove the attachment and finish to a pretty close cut (caution: be sure to use an attachment on long stubble first or it will yank it out). These were the only clippers that didn't require batteries at the time for the price, so that was another plus, and thus I can see these lasting over a decade with consistent use.

  260. Oh no! My clippers just blew up, literally! This is only the 3rd time that I've used them. I was getting them ready to use on my son. I plugged them up, flipped the switch on, then a big internal &#34;POOF&#34; sound, along with a thump in my hand, sudden heat and loud smell of smoke, all in the blink of an eye. The clippers kicked off and I was left standing there, stunned, afraid to move because I got the sense that I had just avoided being electrocuted to death. Up until this moment, I thought these were the best clippers that we've ever owned. My husband has shaved his head with clippers, every other day for the past 20 years. We've owned some sets for over 10 years. This set was just for my sons' hair, which I cut into nice &#34;little boy&#34; cuts. I should have let the hubs use them from the beginning.....at least then we'd known within the first week that they were junk. Now, the return window is gone and I'm stuck with them. :/

  262. not my first choice but its OK and does the job . wouldn't buy again
  263. This Wahl trimmer works great, as expected. It replaced another Wahl trimmer that gave us great service for at least 7 years. The old trimmer was still going strong until I dropped it on the concrete floor. I have dropped it in the past without problem, but this time it hit right on the corner and cracked the housing pretty badly. I thought I could probably glue it back together, but then thought why bother? A replacement trimmer is really not that expensive, and if I don't drop the new one I am sure to get many years of service from it. So I upgraded, and I am happy I did. The new one works great. As expected with a Wahl trimmer.

  299. I've ALWAYS had Conair clippers, ALWAYS, that was until I bought this Wahl clipper. My first experience with a Wahl clipper was with one that my parents bought about 10 years ago to replace the Oster clipper they had owned for close to 20 years. It was dull and ripped my hair out NEW out of the box. They threw it away and bought another Wahl clipper and, although it was better, it was marginally better at most and still was a piece of junk. They then bought a Conair clipper set and it worked exponentially better than any of the Wahl clippers we owned for about 1/2 the price. Needless to say I've owned 2 Conair clippers over the last 8 years. The first one worked great for about 7 years and then it wore out, as bi-weekly haircuts will do. However, the second one I bought only lasted about 4 months, if that, and worked poorly from the get-go. The combs I used kept breaking, it took about an hour to cut from the 1/4\\" my hair had grown to down to the 1/8\\" #1, and because it took so long I was having to stop and re-oil and it got blazing hot in my hands. Then I bought the Wahl Color pro clipper from Target and, although I've only used it twice, it cut my whole head of hair (what's left of it) in less than 10 minutes from oiling, setup, cutting, and putting it away. I'd definitely recommend this for anyone who does home hair cutting. It has at least twice the heft of any of the Conair clippers I've had, cuts ALL of my hair in about 1/10th of the time, has more than enough power to do any kind of hair, and...is only 20$. Can't beat that.
  300. Wroth it!! I was really impress!!
  301. SUPER value.... works great, everything I need to save tons of $$$ by cutting my own hair rather than going to barbershop.
  302. I haven't reviewed anything in ages, but I am so pleased with this that I had to say so. I'm having my 3rd boy, and haircuts for my 2 and 4-year-old boys were definitely taking a hefty bite out of our budget. I knew I had to do something. My sister-in-law taught me how to cut my oldest son's hair on a visit, but I was nervous to get home and go it alone. I bought a set of clippers from Sally Beauty Supply. They were $40, and I couldn't figure out the directions. Plus, the blades were misaligned, and I had no idea how to change that. The vibration when I cut them on was awful. Frustrated, I returned them and got my money back. Then a hairdresser told me about this kit, and that I could get it at Target. It is perfect for people who want to cut hair at home. There is a clear, illustrated guide to cutting men's hair for you to follow. They give you clear, illustrated instructions on what the blade should look like before you get started and directions on how to fix it if it's a little off. Mine was, and a simple screwdriver fixed that with no problem. There are plenty of hair guide combs, and the clipper feels heavy duty without lots of vibration. This is a WAY better deal for my money than the overpriced clippers at Sally's. I have two squirmy boys, but their first haircuts with me by myself went really well. These clippers blended better than my sister-in-law's set. I feel like I definitely got my money's worth out of this set already, and I've only used it once. Everything fit back in the kit just fine, and it wasn't hard to get the hair out with the little brush included. Tips to giving a haircut to little boys that I've already learned.... 1. Do the haircut outside where you can sweep or blow off the hair. 2. Use long guards to start off with, and only use two guards, something like a 7 on the bottom and sides and a 6 on the top. You don't have a lot of time when cutting little boy hair. =) 3. Coat your kids in baby powder after you're finished. It takes the hair off really well and brushes off pretty easily.
  303. Great clipper. Will buy again

  369. This is a wonderful product, at a great price. Given what I had been paying for professional haircuts, this clipper paid for itself after the second haircut! That means that for as long as I have an electric outlet to plug it in, I'm now getting free haircuts.<br /><br />It seems solid and durable. The plastic combs, which snap on to the clipper to adjust the length, are in color-coded by size, with a key to the colors on the clipper itself. Initially, this seemed like a gimmick, but it actually makes it very easy to find the one you're looking for. The combs range from 1/8&#34; to 1-and-1/4&#34; by 1/8&#34; increments, long with three additional combs: a 1/16&#34; size, and two that are tapered, for use around your left and right ears. The tapered ear combs are a great idea, but take a little getting used to, especially if you are cutting your own hair.<br /><br />My only regret is not buying this sooner, and enjoying even more free haircuts.
  370. Works better than the almost identical one it replaced (theft, not worn out). I thought the color-coded combs were a bit silly -- I was wrong. Much easier to pick the color from the bunch than the actual thickness or the writing. The comb material and locking method are both, in my opinion, much less likely to cause the comb to fail from stress cracking after long service than the previous black combs. I don't know anything about today's black combs. I would hope they're made exactly like these colored ones; the improvement in the design/materials of the combs is significant. The motor is the almost silent oscillating one that tends to start with a sharp *snap* - the kind I like. This type of motor has an adjustment screw that should be set (and is, by the factory) at just barely tighter than the point at which the clippers suddenly makes a huge racket. On my copy they'd shaved the just barely part a bit too thin and I had to tweak it. No harm unless having it sound like it's coming apart an inch from your ear scares you into doing something you regret. Scissors and hair comb are junk, but I never expected otherwise. Highly recommended.
  371. Clippers work fine, just the case hinges are both broken.

  380. I've had this trimmer for about 2 years now, I remember buying it on sale for 17.99 at target. I just use it to buzz my head, usually about once or twice a month. I also used it to trim my beard for a little while until I got a separate beard trimmer. This trimmer is great... my hair is pretty thick, but all I have to do is dampen my hair with a little water and I'm done buzzing my head in about 15 minutes. The trimmer itself is thick and a little heavy (which I like), and the motor must be strong because I don't remember it ever catching on my hair. If I had one gripe, its that the little plastic pieces have been starting to get loose, sometimes the ones I use often snap off mid-trim. After 2 years, that might be expected... All in all though, a great product for such a cheap price.

He called me to tell me what happened. I called Amazon and got \\"Ace\\" as my customer service agent. He was very sympathetic and said he has the same clippers which have served him well for the past six months. He emailed me a label I could print so I could send back the old clippers without paying shipping. The new clippers arrived in less than 48 hrs. which is amazing considering we live in Hawaii. Anything we order through Amazon that comes from Amazon verses a company just advertising through Amazon seems to have wonderful return policy service. The funny thing is, the day I went to pick up the defective clippers my son said they turned on again. Sounds like a loose wire inside the clipper to us but I'd still rather get one that doesn't stop in the middle of the hair cut since I'm no electrician or handyman. I'm giving this clipper a 2 star rating for right now since it was defective but may amend my rating once I hear how the new clipper work for my son. When it worked, it was great. Cut well, very little hair pulling. He was happy with it. Let's see how the replacement one does. Lemons happen and not everything that comes off the assembly line will be perfect.

  472. I got this clipper primarily to keep my beard trimmed. I was hoping the lever on the left side of the trimmer was a blade adjustment lever, and it is. This lets me go from about a 1mm length to about a 4 or 5mm length, the perfect range for a very trim beard. I was a bit concerned that the wider blade (compared to dedicated, purpos-made beard trimmers) would be an issue. It wasn't, at all. If you want a quality trimmer for your beard, this is a good choice.<br /><br />It feels well made. I wouldn't mind if it were a bit heavier in construction, but I expect it to work well for years; it's made in the USA, and has a 5-year warranty. The bright colors on the trimmer and the combs are a bit much, but I don't expect to use it in front of an audience at black tie events, so who cares. This trimmer can get you looking good for those events, though!<br /><br />Some people have commented on the noise level of some Wahl trimmers. Well, the loudest clippers I've ever heard have all been in the hands of professional barbers, so a loud trimmer doesn't really bother me. This one is louder than the cordless beard trimmer I was using before (a Conair GMT183W), but not nearly as loud as some of the clippers I've heard in barber shops. Behind a closed bathroom door, I don't think anyone would notice, and it certainly isn't unpleasant to the user.<br /><br />I gave it 4 stars because of the colors and because I'd like it to be a little heavier in construction. And because it takes a LOT for me to hand out a 5-star rating. If this thing is still chugging in several years, I'll come back and bump it up to five.

  499. These are my first Wahl clippers to own and I really like them and I like how the guard is color coded. The motor in these clippers feels much stronger than other hair clippers that I've used in the past. I didn't have any problems at all using them to cut my hair and it never snagged my hair any. I did order the #12 guard but I haven't received it yet as its still being shipped. I like my hair short on the sides and faded to the top. So I start with a #2 and work my way up to #8 and takes me about 30 minutes for me to cut my own hair. I will change out the #8 with the #12 as soon as I get it.
  500. I've owned plenty of Wahl products over the last 20 years (both for people and pets) to know what I'd be getting. I'm very happy with my purchase, and like the color-coding of the attachments.<br /><br />I bought this so I could cut my 17 month old son's hair. If his haircuts don't come out well, I'll have to endure the razzing from family members. But I looked at the instructions, and I also looked on YouTube for videos on how to cut a child's hair with clippers, and I soon realized that if you go slow and conservative until you build confidence, that's the best approach. Start with a larger attachment and work your way down, blending as you go.<br /><br />I cut his hair today, and I think it came out better than the two times I took him to a shop where they used scissors to cut his hair. My son was nervous at first about the clippers, but I sat outside and held him in my lap as I trimmed, and when I started running the clipper through his hair, he relaxed and realized it wasn't going to hurt.<br /><br />This has already paid for itself. I can't wait to show off his new do -- and I won't let on that I cut it myself.
  501. This product saved me from the trouble of going to the barber shop (which is a little far) and paying $16 for a haircut. The price of this item is almost equivalent to a professional haircut; however, you get to keep it and just use it again and again. I don't know why I never thought about buying my own clippers before. This Wahl clipper comes in a nice carrying case, which you can use to store everything once you are done. The main picture of the item does a great job showing what's inside the box. Everything is color coded so if you can't read the numbers written on the guides (some of them are small), you can refer to the colors. The case also contains a \\"Beginner's Guide\\" for cutting your hair at home for the first time. Although it shows you which guide to use where, I was a little afraid to cut it too short so I basically added 2 to the number that it gave me. The final outcome was great. In fact, I will stick to the numbers I used (#8 for the longer parts, #6 for the mids and #3 for the sides and back). However, I like my hair a little longer so if you like a more \\"normal\\" haircut, I'll suggest you to follow the recommendations on the Beginner's Guide. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase. In the long run, this will save me at least a couple of hundreds of dollars. I recommend Wahl clippers to everyone.

  514. This product replaces a Wahl kit we bought more than 20 years ago. We had to replace the original only because we dropped the clipper while cleaning it, after my wife finished cutting my hair. The new clipper has a solid feel in the hand, it is more easily adjustable, and the kit of plastic parts, combs, scissors, and case tops the paper box we got with the earlier product. We paid a little more for this clipper than we did for the one we bought 20 years ago, but then isn't everything more expensive now? The good news is that Wahl still offers an excellent, US-made product at a very reasonable price.

  633. I was long overdue for a new set of clippers as our current ones are very dull. I do not like having to spend money on 2 males every 3-4 weeks and home hair cutting is something we have done for years. This set of clippers has a great color coding system where each comb has a different color for each size. The combs go from 1/2-8 so whether you are wanting to achieve the bald look, or shaggy you will get it. This is a 20 piece kit which has everything to get you started on cutting hair at home. My husband does the bald look and these have worked great. The site also gives great video demonstrations. You will also get written instructions in the kit with photos on how to cut hair, outline, blend, trim brows, taper and more. The clippers aren't very lightweight, but are not that heavy either. The case is plastic and all the pieces just go inside, which leaves me wondering if the combs pieces will break while inside, but just be careful. A great kit for home haircutting!
  634. The clipper looks sturdy and nice. It cuts my hair well but it vibrates a lot and also makes really loud noise. I adjusted the power screw as in the manual, but that wouldn't help much.<br />3 stars for a good set of guide combs.

  655. Years ago a good friend gave me his electric clippers and that changed my life. I gave myself my first buzz cut with them and immediately found the only hair style that seemed to fit me. Years later, I have since retired the original trimmer and after a short-lived experiment with another brand that fell apart too easily, I now have this Wahl kit. I've been using this these clippers for over a year now and couldn't be more satisfied with their performance. Although I only ever need one or two for specific tasks, the variety of attachments provides a range of options and unlike my previous unit, these are somewhat strongly constructed, as the plastic tines aren't as flimsy and moving around as some lesser brands do. The motor is strong and as long as this thing is properly maintained with a little bit of oil now and then, is relatively quiet. I generally use NO attachments to shave my head and trim my facial stubble and never any issues or \\"bites\\".<br /><br />This is a great, high quality, high value, kit that I'd recommend to anyone.<br /><br />**One year update -- January 2013**<br />-These clippers are still going strong!

We even took the blades off and re adjusted it because I thought it was misaligned but it still was having an issue cutting.   659. I bought the Wahl Color Pro for cutting my own hair. I followed the instructions and got a pretty good hair cut out of it. I did have to get help with trimming the nape of my neck, but I managed to do a pretty good job of the rest of it on my own.<br /><br />The clipper is heavy and seems to be of good quality. The items in the kit are great. One reason I knocked off a star is that the guide combs supplied max out at a number 8, which means all you can do is a short haircut or shorter. They should have really included the longer #10 and #12 guide combs so that some medium length cuts could be attempted. Apparently you have to buy the extra combs ($8.00 for two combs) which seems excessive that 2 combs can cost more than one third the cost of the whole kit.<br /><br />The combs at first seem stiff and take a little effort to clip them in place. The items are just sort of piled into the case. It would be nice if the case was larger and had spots where each items could fit into it's own space.<br /><br />I have yet to try cutting someone else's hair with it, but it would have to be easier than cutting my own. I'm pretty sure if you have some talent, within two or three efforts the cuts would be good enough that people couldn't really tell you didn't get them from a barbershop unless they are nit pickers. Definitely watch some of the WAHL haircutting videos on their site. Using the rocking motion really helps to blend each section/length of hair in with the next layer.<br /><br />I reckon I saved the cost of the clippers on my first cut. A trip to the barber for me would be $15.00 plus $5.00 tip. The kit cost me $20.00 so I've already broken even. I suspect these clippers, as long as you don't bang them around, would last 20 years.<br /><br />Other than that, I'm looking at buying some hair tonic so that I can get the whole &#34;barbershop&#34; effect at home. I would recommend these clippers to anyone looking to cut their own or other's hair. The only two things that separated my giving this clipper five stars is the lack of including #10 and #12 (longer) guide combs, and maybe a case that could hold each item in their place rather than just piling all the bits and pieces into the case.

  731. I purchased a Wahl clipper about 12 years ago and it finally died 2 years ago. I used that thing pretty hard, hair is VERY thick in our family. Shopping locally, I couldn't find a good deal on another Wahl, so I let the lady talk me into an Andis. Since this is not a review for Andis, I will summarize by saying it was a waste of money. After fighting with it for 2 years, I went shopping online and found this Wahl Color Pro clipper for an incredible price.<br /><br />I am thrilled to have a Wahl again! The clipper itself is a little heavier than I remember it, but I only do up to 2 haircuts in a row and my hand doesn't fatigue. It cuts very thick hair without having to make several passes. Went I first bought it, I thought the colored guards were silly but whatever, couldn't hurt. Now that I have used it, I really like having the color guide right on the clipper so when I go to switch, it really is easier; no squinting to read black raised print on black to make sure I grab the right guard which actually makes changing guards faster. A fast switch buys you valuable time when cutting a wiggly kid's hair. The cord length is adequate for cutting hair in the kitchen, but it's easier to let my child watch TV while I cut hair and I do have to use an extension cord when cutting hair in the living room. I haven't used the scissors yet because I have a pair of my own I prefer, but they aren't what I bought the clippers for anyway. The set contains enough guards to give you a variety of cuts. The hard case is a nice bonus, everything fits in it easily. This purchase was an excellent value, especially for the quality of Wahl.<br /><br />I would recommend this set to anyone who needs a good clipper for home use.

  751. I expected this trimmer to be a low quality option for quick haircuts. I've purchased various hair trimmers previously from different manufacturers, and they are always light plastic cheap devices that break within a few months, even under moderate use. Puny. Puny! It's like they weren't designed to handle a man's glorious mane. But this trimmer, THIS trimmer, however, is sturdy and solid, with a heavy metal casing that really gives it some weight. I feel like I could crack open walnuts with it, or defend the realm from invading armies. When you look at the packaging, you have an expectation of a glorified beard trimmer in a festive mood. That is to say, it's bright and colorful and curvy, which suggests it's going to be underpowered or fragile. But no - this thing has gravitas, and you know it from the moment you pick it up, and then proceed to hammer in nails through hardened steel. I turned it on and was pleased with the roaring, powerful warcry it emitted. Yes, it is a little on the loud side, but lots of awesome things are. Like television, and LIONS. Lions are awesome. What do you people have against lions? Nothing, that's what. I then ran it through the brutal obstacle course of my head, throwing endless armies of brambled follicles, the kind with mean streaks and meaner grins, who drink straight from the milk jug and don't wash their hands enough, and have tattoos with the names of all their enemies and ex-lovers. Hair with tattoos, you heard it here first. The trimmer took one look and mowed them down with relaxed fury, literally cutting them down to size (eight available with this set, create your own style today!) in crisp, uniform lengths. I was so impressed that I went out and trimmed the lawn and some tree branches (which work best with the 3/4\\" attachment). Note: Product not authorized for landscaping work, I playfully made that up. Doublenote: OR WAS I? Because you certainly wouldn't know once you fire this baby up and watch it bring on the POWER. I would caution using this without an attachment/guard on it, as you are liable to cut yourself if you press it directly. So do use some caution. If you're a wimp, that is. Not me though, but I feel the need to warn all the other wimps out there. You wimps, you. You can also pair this up with different attachments from Wahl, including [[ASIN:B000UZEQK0 Wahl #12 clipper guide comb, 1&1/2.]] for longer style cuts. They snap right on without issue, useful for those wanting heftier styles. This does lend some useful versatility to the product, which I appreciate. You will appreciate it too. The case gets the job done, but it does lack any kind of internal organization - there's nothing to slot the attachments into, for example. Things will jumble around and get disorganized, but this is a minor complaint. There is enough room for another few attachments in addition to the included stock, as it is roomy enough to accommodate a few added accessories. The cord could probably bit a tiny bit longer. Most things are better longer. Except for hair, which is why you are buying this thing in the first place. In short: highly recommended. Manly recommended. Grab you one and unleash the wonderful mightiness. Hold it high above your newly clean-cut head and watch lighting bolts dance behind you as you part the heavens in your magnificence.
  752. Great product to use at home. Slightly heavy and vibrates a bit but still does the job. The different color coded clippers are also great. Easy to clean. I like it so far... I have used it 3-4 times since my purchase.

We also notice that the thing that supposed to be vibrating and attached to the blade was not aligned properly. Don't waste your time, get a better one. Returned.

I'm sure it'd work as well on the top of someone's head as it works on my beard. Previous clipper (NOT a Wahl) used to trip moisture-resistant circuit in bathroom several times while trimming beard. This clipper doesn't. Couldn't be happier w/ it.
  761. I ordered this to cut my own hair. I hate paying for and getting haircuts. This works real well. I just leave the dark blue comb guide and have no problems. Edit: Now I just use it without a comb. It also works on beards very well.<br /><br />One hint: before starting the cutter up the first time, I highly recommend oiling the blades. The factory may not have oiled the blades and if started they may freeze up. Place the unused oil straight up on an out-of-the-way shelf, so it does not leak.<br /><br />I was surprised at how wide and powerful this was. Cutting my hair for the first time was a breeze!

  814. I bought this today after reading reviews that it has a powerful motor. I usually get a #2 on the side, and #5 on top. I haven't had a haircut in 4 months, so my hair was a long and thick. This clipper cut right through it, no problems. Only bogged down twice. This is the first time I cut my own hair. It turned out as good as the barber. This comes with good instructions, and links to Wahl's website with videos showing how to give different haircuts. It says to start with a thick guide. But, since I knew I always get #2 and #5, I did that, using #3 & 4 to blend the side and top. Turned out fine. I usually pay $15 (including tip), but save money by delaying haircuts for 3-4. If this thing lasts 2-3 years, I'm going to save $120-$180. Plus, I'll cut my hair more often. For the price, I'm impressed with the quality of the clipper. It's heavy and the motor feels powerful. The plastic case leaves a little to be desired. Everything's loose in it. And, I worry the plastic guides won't last long. But, for $20, it almost paid for itself with the first cut. I'm usually leery of cheap products. I was going to spend $120-$150 for a professional-grade Oster Classic 76. But, since I've never cut my own hair before, I was worried about making that kind of investment. Based on the positive reviews, I gambled on this Wahl. I'm glad I did. The quality is definitely worth more than the $20 price. And, the instructional materials were valuable for a first-timer like me. I was thinking when this breaks (after the experience I would have obtained at a low price) I might invest in a professional clipper. But, I don't know. If it lasts 2-3 years it's probably a better value to pay $20 for that length of use compared to a more expensive pro model requiring blade sharpening, replaced motor brushes, etc.
  815. I took a chance and started cutting my children's (boys) hair myself. The younger one was easy because his curls are so tight that any mistakes I made with be sucked into his head. I just did his whole head in the longest length, then used one 3 levels down for the sides and just went from bottom to top and stopped when it felt right. It worked out pretty well.   909. I get my hair cut every 3-4 weeks at Great Clips for $22. So on average I spend close to $300/yr on getting my hair cut, and that's a cheap cut that starts looking funky. I used to go to a barbershop that charged $46 for a basic haircut, but after three months I realized it wasn't worth it.<br /><br />This is my second pair of Wahl clippers. I had gotten a more expensive set a few years ago, but could never get myself to do the first cut (I was going to cut it myself). Ended up gifting it to a friend who promptly began cutting his own hair, and very well.<br /><br />I finally picked this up in lieu of going to GC, and after briefly looking at the cutting instructions, began cutting my own hair. (I wear glasses that I had to remove, which was also pretty terrifying). I used #4 for the bottom section of my hair, #5 for the middle, and the top #8 for the top of my head. I haven't gotten to doing the ears myself yet, but seeing how I did it myself with no glasses on (-5/-5.25 vision, so it's pretty bad!) and got good results, I don't see it being too hard.<br /><br />I think making the decision to cut my own hair is one of the best cost cutting methods that'll save me hundreds each year. If I do need a good quality haircut, I'll just go into the barbershop and cough up the extra money, but otherwise, now that I've taken the first step to cut my own hair, I'll just do that.<br /><br />Remember, until you're really comfortable with how you like your hair, use the largest guards and work your way down until you're satisfied with the length!

I was surprised they are not cordless so I have to cut his hair close to an electrical outlet but no big deal... it's powerful, does the job and is now saving us about $250 a year - above all, it's super convenient for me to be able to cut his hair anytime, amy place we like - saving time, hassle, driving, finding new places etc. Can't believe the value for money being under $20! I will say that the adapters don't really do much, and never cut very close. So, you're crap outta luck if you don't have a huge Brian Wilson beard. You will put this thing on your face, and you will feel it. In fact, if you cut your hair with it, you will feel it if it even touches your skin. You will be left with a scrape or two, here and there, regarding cutting hair on the scalp with it. Your neck will not take too kindly to it, and you will be left with welts, etc. They sting like hell, when it's all said and done. But, if you want a clean shave, here it is. Go for it.

My son was a little curious about the vibrating device Mommy was putting near his head, but I had his father playing with a toy in front of him so he wouldn't be too concerned. They cut well enough to accomodate all.<br /><br />The color coded attachments work well enough and make it very easy to quickly identify what size you are grabbing.<br /><br />Really, the only reason to get something better than this, for cutting human hair, is if you need a SUPER CLOSE &#34;zero&#34; trim. It is &#34;safe&#34; enough to not cut or irritate your face.<br /><br />The only real negative I can say is the blade setup usually doesn't survive a direct hit from being dropped. These are easy to hold onto, but I have dropped two different sets. With one, the mounting sysem became permanently loose. With another, a few teeth from one of the blades snapped off.<br /><br />another slight negative is that the blades do eventually rust/tarnish a bit. IT's not major, but it will happen at some point. It usually takes several months for this to happen, however.<br /><br />I'm about to purchase my third set, since 2010. As stated, both only became unusable, after dropping. I use them to trim my head every week. Something that would cost $10 - $20 at a professional hair place. for the price of these clippers, I can cut my hair every week, for about two years, before needing a new set. That's great value.

  986. I was more than just a little bit skeptical when I purchased this product, I was worried about the quality, I was worried about the attachments, I was worried about it being corded.<br />But opening up the case and holding the the clipper, its quite heavy, in a very good way. It uses very strong construction, and you can be sure it'll work, every single time.<br />The cord doesn't really get in the way and its pretty long and I'm sure it allows the trimmer to use much more power than batteries would.<br />And most importantly the attachments, I cut my hair pretty short but I didn't realize how short til I had to keep going the next size down on the attachments. These attachments give ample room for error if you're doing short hair, but if it's still too short, you can purchase a few of the bigger attachments separately. Speaking of attachments, they have quite solid construction as well. A similar Norelco trimmer had such poor construction for both clipper and attachments, the Wahl seems like a $200 clipper in comparison.<br />Wahl is the company you should trust for your hair clipper needs.
  987. Prefect product to cut your families hair and you can not beat the price. I would recommend this product to anyone.
  988. I use this item every month to cut my husbands hair. It cuts hair very well. What I don't like about it is that it is very heavy for me. I'm a strong person and after 5 mins my hands are aching from holding it. Other then that this tool saves us a ton of money.
  989. Can't beat Wahl. Always been the best value out there. This one will last me 10 years like the last one.
  990. These clippers work great. The guards fit snugly onto the body, and I haven't had any problems since I got them. I have used them a couple times. They are plastic, and will probably not stand up to abuse, but for the price, and when I am planning on just using them when I need a trim they are perfect.
  991. Well made product...Great for home use.... Easy to use.... Would highly recommend.

I cleaned the blades every month, and oiled them well. Never rusted and the motor never failed.

  994. Great product, easy to use, works on very wiry, thick hair. Don't forget to oil it after each use, and don't use on wet hair - the blades rust immediately!
  995. I haven't had it long enough to know the longevity of this product, but it works like a charm and the color coding was a stroke of genius--much easier to find what you need quickly.
  996. Even after reading the reviews here, I was still taken aback by how sturdy and solid this clipper is. For the low price I would expect a far more inferior product. The casing is cheaper plastic, sure, but feels quite sturdy and durable. The clippers have an excellent weighted feel to them and hum very appealingly. And the addition of the 10 different sized guides make this package a no brainer must buy to anyone thinking about cutting their own hair.<br /><br />As a parting note, i'd recommend getting an extra bottle of clipper oil with this, as i feel it will extend the longevity of these clippers by a large margin.
  997. Best part is that it is not as noisy as previous one. Excellent accessories - can be used for many different hair lengths. Trims nicely. Sorry I waited so long to buy it.
  998. I bought this kit because I am a college student and it is cheaper to simply give myself a buzz fade. My mother used to cut my hair with the same clippers so I knew what to expect. For such a good price, one can't really go wrong with these. It's smooth and has all kinds of sizes and a couple of tapers. I just used them for my first haircut with them and they work way better than the ones I borrowed from my buddy. One word of caution would be to make sure you don't drop it. The previous Wahl I had experienced would have the power switch get jammed or work weird, but that was after two years of use and being dropped all the time (wasn't me I swear). If you take care of them, these should last you along time and do anything you need to do with your haircut.
  999. To be truthful, I wasn't expecting a lot for this price. I just wanted to experiment with cutting my own hair, and my son's, without a hefty investment.<br /><br />The unit itself was solid, and had a latch for cleaning - big plus. This is not a disposable trimmer - better quality than I figured for the price. Maybe a little heavier than other models/brands<br /><br />All the height level attachments worked, and even used the left and right clips for my son's head. Worked perfectly the first time. I like to use a #1 on myself, so I'm trimming every couple of weeks without any pulling.<br /><br />Overall, it definitely exceeded my expectations<br /><br />Pros: all the components, solid trimmer, carry case, scissors, combs<br /><br />Cons: weight (gotta switch hands every once in a while)
  1000. This is probably the most powerful trimmer I've ever had - and one of the least expensive ones. This isn't a little travel trimmer with rechargeable battery, this is more like what you might find in a barber shop. It's much stronger/heavier.sturdy than your basic travel trimmer and it requires that you plug it in. Also comes with a plastic case, tons of levels and two pairs of scissors. Well worth $20.

  1004. Have to say I am very disappointed. I had read some reviews before buying with mostly positives in the comments and in particular how relatively quiet the clippers where. When I first plugged them into mains power using an always previously successful and still currently working well converter I was amazed at how these sounded like a petrol powered lawn mower. First impression not good at all, then in less than six strokes through my beard smoke began to rise off the bladed end of the clippers and the handle became quickly and dangerously warm. Having since purchased the same kit at a retail outlet I can assure that they are indeed quiet and have no issues. After paying AUD 22.76 for the item as well as AUD 41.82 for a faster delivery giving a total of AUD 64.58 to Amazon and then in the process of claiming a refund paying a further AUD 46.50 in order to post the item back to Amazon, I can only hope that Amazon will do the right thing in terms of reimbursing me. As I mentioned, with all the positive reviews, I can only suppose that I was unlucky to say the least, however with differences in packaging and the ridiculously loud noise omitted by this clipper set I have my doubts about the genuine status of the item I was sent. I have sent the clippers back and will update this review in regard to the outcome of the refunding to me. UPDATE : Amazon has refunded me in total and I will consider further purchases given this excellent policy attitude.

Amazon also sells this product with more guides, so you may want to checks the different sets available to see which one suits you best. For longer lengths, it works best if you take your time and comb a small section of hair away from the head while bending over, then slowly and without force glide the clipper across the hair section. I finish up my haircut with thinning shears and a razor cutter so it doesn't look too choppy. It saves me hundreds $$$ every year by doing it myself.

  1213. A sturdy unit that comes with quite a few guides to let you choose how close it will clip. It makes looking neat easy.<br /><br />I was told by a hairdresser to clip from the bottom up, and that I might want to use a different guide on the blade when clipping my sides than when clipping my top; many people like their top a bit longer. She told me what guide(s) to use if using two, and what guide to use if using one. Works like a charm.<br /><br />I like that this clipper does not get hot even if you're fussing about with it for quite a while. The ones I used on the dogs when I was a kid got uncomfortably hot, and were also very loud. This one is unexpectedly nice by comparison.<br /><br />The one negative I'd note is not a matter of build quality or design flaw, but is about how you intend to use the clipper. This one has a cord, so you'd better be close by an outlet. You'll pay extra for ones without a cord, but for some it may be worth it. With a clipper, you can do a lot of your cut by feel, just doing some touch-ups in front of a mirror. For a close-cut style, you'll have to clip your hair a lot to keep a consistent length, and it would be nice to just wander outside or into the garage and let my hair fall where it might, then sweep up afterward. With a corded clipper, I am bound to the sink, and my falling hair gets into every crack and crevice of the floor and countertop and sink. This is a good and sturdy unit, but I'd seriously consider spending extra for a cordless if I were to buy one again.

  1263. I bought this today (not from Amazon, but from a Fry's nearby) based on all the good reviews, so was surprised to find some obvious, annoying drawbacks. I think the unit has a motor much stronger than the body that houses it, with the result that the body vibrates uncomfortably and gets annoyingly warm. If the plastic guide is not seated right, you hear this very loud noise that will make your heart skip a beat. And last but not least, the rocker switch button offers a lot of resistance. If you frequently turn it on-off during a 10-15 minute cut, as you adjust, change guides, and take pauses, your thumb will start hurting.<br />I had a 5 year old Remington, ten dollars more expensive, that never had these issues. Of course, it's motor was probably not as powerful, but I did not find it needing any more than what it already had.<br />One plus for this Wahl unit is that the blades feel a bit sharper - but I cannot tell for sure, and in any case, it is too early to say if it will stay that way.

They do not trim as neatly around my facial hair as I had hoped, but I also use them, (without attachments), to cut my hair, and I am very pleased with how they function for this job.   1331. This haircutting kit was more than we were expecting. The clippers are definitely high quality, and they feel very solid and well constructed. The color coded cutting guide attachments make the whole process VERY easy, and they fit rather snug ... but then you want them to, so they don't come loose when in use. The unit does come with a itsy bitsy, very tiny bottle of oil (I'd recommend purchasing a 4 oz bottle of the Wahl clipper oil ... for home use, a 4 oz bottle should last a LONG time, and is only about $4 here on Amazon.com ... http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000B9SFQG/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_1), so be sure to oil the blades before your first use, after every cleaning (which should be after every use, IMHO), and before each subsequent use to help keep the blades sharp and running cool and quiet. Speaking of quiet, these clippers are as quiet -- if not more quiet -- than the ones used in the haircutting salons that I've frequented over the years.<br /><br />We should be able to save some cash during these strapped financial times by having my wife give me my relatively simple haircut at home, instead of the $15 to $20 I spent every six to eight weeks. Plus, the more of my very hard earned cash I can keep, rather than handing it over to the filthy rich 1% to make them even richer, the better.

  1357. At first I thought it was only the one but it's all of mine. I've never had this problem before, maybe in time they'll loosen up? I was afraid I was going to snap the attachment or have one of those incidents when you're forcing something and then it gives all at once and everything flies out of your hands crashing about. So far that's been avoided.<br /><br />I knocked another star because while it's nice to have a case, putting everything back in, so it fits and it can snap closed reminds me of doing a 500 piece puzzle. The case is very tight for all the components that fit in it.<br /><br />For the price, I paid about $18, I think it was a good deal.

  1429. UPDATE 6/29/2019<br /><br />A little bit over two years or use and this clipper is still going strong. I have now a routine of cutting my hair every six weeks. I used to pay $15 per cut... that is about $ 260 savings... this thing paid itself already about ten times...<br /> - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -<br />Long time ago I had a a Wahl made hair clipper I bought at my local CVS, it served me well for over three years, my ex kept it when we split. So last time I handed my barber a $20 and he gave me $2 back was the crossing line for me.<br />Did some research and found this little clipper, it had the most positive reviews of any, at the time well over 1,400. How can I go wrong.<br />When I opened the case I found an assortment of color coded comb/attachments that proven very handy and make hair cutting much easier, the included scissors (although not the best) are adequate for the job; but the clippers was the jewel of all. it feels very sturdy, strong, well made, this thing is very well designed, ergonomically correct as it fits my right and left hand easily and I can do the back of my head with no problem. I did one hair cut so far (not the best haircut ever but I blame the barber for that), now I can get a hair cut every 2 weeks and not wait 4 as it was my case. All I need is two hair cuts and this unit will pay for itself and I also made some money on it. Needless say it I am very pleased with this product and I highly recommend, keep in mind is not for professional use but for home. Also my unit never got hot at all.<br /><br />All in all it cost me $26.51 delivered to my front door.

It comes with plenty of length adjusting combs, and the blending lever is a nice idea, though I usually just blend manually because that's what I'm used to. My only criticisms are very minor: The power switch is not that easy to manipulate by feel, due to its location and rigidity. Also, some of the combs are unnecessarily sharp and have the tendency to cause a bit of pain if they catch your skin while you're guiding them up the scalp. It's not a big deal, but other clippers I've used had more rounded comb tips, not sharp points at the ends. Again, these are very minor points. I would buy this again without reservation.

  1595. Also great for beard trimming etc. I bought the previous model 10-15 years ago and it still works as good as ever after weekly usage. Make sure to put a couple drops of oil on the blades, then run it for a second to spread the oil, and cover them with the plastic protector thing before putting it away. I only bought this new one because my most frequently used plastic &#34;guides&#34; have broken. These guides can break if dropped, but break during normal attaching and detaching as well. They are the only problem, particularly because they are evidently irreplaceable. I do not know why Wahl doesn't offer replacements, and at a reasonable cost. Actually there are some guides for sale, but they're very expensive and there is no telling if they will really fit since they do not appear to be genuine. So, I bought this because it was cheaper to buy the guides, which come with a razor, this way than trying to replace a couple of broken guides. The new guides are now designed slightly differently than before, but they fit they old razor fine. So I haven't used the new razor, and maybe never will as long as the old one works and stays sharp. New Wahl replacement blades are available, and generally cost less than a whole razor (imagine that).

  1629. Wow, for the price, shoot...for any price. This is a really high-quality​ razor. It's heavy and solid, very capable. Which made a simple home cut a time-consuming affair repeatedly going over and over the same areas.<br /><br />This new Wahl clipper thing plows through my hair like a lawnmower! It's relatively quiet as well, I'm not experienced with too many clippers, but I'd not list noise as any type of complaint whatsoever.<br /><br />I'd recommend this product vigorously to anyone on the hunt for clippers.
  1630. It feels a little heavy in hand but it cuts beautifully and precisely. The color-coded trim attachments are a sensible design and the product seems well-made. It's head and shoulders better than my Remington which lasted only a year with infrequent use but we'll have to see how it fare over time.
  1631. After 10 minutes I swear my hand was going to fall off due to the vibration that this thing generated, but for less than $20 what should I have expected?<br /><br />The motor is powerful and I do like the color coding of the different attachments.<br /><br />In time I may step up to a more expensive model, but I only cut my hair every few months, so I may live with it for a few years.

This one seems much more well built and has the blade adjustment lever that mine did not have. My son and I have used it for about 4 months and really like it. I did not know much about Wahl cutters before getting this one -- I am sold and am a Wahl customer now. I will buy another Wahl when this one is no longer working. But I expect it to last several years. I also like the great color coded selection of attachments.

The guides are easy to change. Instead of a half hour of struggling with our son, we can do a few 10-min sessions over an afternoon--cut most of the hair, even it out, edge for completion--all while watching cartoons. I got tired of buying battery-powered beard/mustache trimmers which always suffer the same fate--the rechargeable battery won't hold a charge anymore (which usually happens within a year or two) and the whole thing becomes useless. Actually I now refuse to buy anything with a rechargeable battery that cannot be replaced by the consumer. I use rechargeable batteries for everything, but many devices have a hard-wired rechargeable battery that cannot easily be replaced, so now such devices are off my shopping list.<br /><br />After making sure this trimmer was suitable for trimming my beard and mustache I ordered it, at that reasonable price it didn't seem like much of a risk. I was immediately impressed by the weight and feel of quality, it just doesn't feel like a disposable plastic item that will only last a couple of years. It's quiet too, and works like a charm. The plastic depth combs are too long to use on a mustache so I carefully use just the basic blades for that area. Since there is no vacuum as on my previous trimmer there is a little more cleanup of the bathroom sink, but that only takes a few moments.<br /><br />Made in America quality, a very reasonable price, what more could I ask for? I cannot comment on the use of this product to cut hair, but when it comes to trimming beards and mustaches I recommend it highly.

They did fit very snug to the clippers and had ZERO movement when on the clipper. Less powerful cutters take twice as long to cut thick hair, and rechargeable ones run out of steam too quickly.   1897. I've been cutting my own hair for about 20 years. This is a good hair trimmer. It feels sturdy. The motor is powerful and cuts thick beard as well as head hair. It doesn't pull. Having a lot of attachments is nice, though I suggest taking the ones you know you won't use and storing them someplace so they don't get lost or get in the way. There are a lot of trifling criticisms of this trimmer here in the reviews, and I suggest you don't think too much on them unless you are a professional who does many haircuts every day.

  1932. I purchased the WAHL several months ago because my husband was constantly complaining about the back of his hair getting unruly and long before it was time to get another haircut. So I did a little research and latched onto this Wahl clippers. I didn't want a large outlay of dollars as this was just going to be used a couple of times a month on a very small area.<br /><br />After a couple of cautious attempts, I've become quite good at trimming up the errant hair and my husband is quite pleased with the results.   1981. I've had the kit for about 2 years now, it's still going strong. The trimmer itself feels hefty, solid, and sturdy. Everything else in the kit feels cheap and plastic, but nothing's broken in 2 years, so I suppose it must be okay. The trimmer still cuts through hair easily with no pulling, and the noise level is about average for a trimmer, I think (not sure, I don't pay that much attention to how much noise other trimmers make). I use it every 3-4 weeks or so. This was definitely a good buy that paid off in the long run.<br /><br />For me, the instruction pamphlet is probably the most valuable accessory in this kit -- I kid you not, every single time I go to use this kit, I refer to the instructions again. For some reason I have not been able to remember how to do a haircut yet, after having done at least a few dozen cuts. (I think that scares my victim/husband a little.) The instructions are super clear, come with color photos and diagrams, and are broken down in a way that makes it easy to find and reference specific tasks (i.e. easy to scan and find the section specifically pertaining to trimming around the ears when I'm at that stage in the haircut, etc etc). We've not had a bad haircut with this kit yet.<br /><br />My least favorite thing about using this kit is cramming everything back into the plastic case. I've removed all the clipper attachments that we don't usually use so that there's more room, and I still hate it. Everything rattles around, the cord just goes in whichever way, there's no \\"everything in its place\\".<br /><br />Overall, this kit is great. It gets the job done easily, great bang for the buck, it's reliable and durable. If you've never given a haircut before and you're considering it in order to save some $$...do it!
  1982. brand new items good stuff, start cutting my own hair prety strong blade prety smooth will def buy again if needed

  1984. This is one of the best purchases I've ever made. Compared to other, similarly priced clippers, these are a steel and have worked flawlessly so far.   1990. My hair grows fast so I cut it every 1-2 weeks (often, I know). Therefore, it's really important I get a quality buzzer.   2048. Pros<br /><br />- Comes with many combs for different shades and even a few combs used specifically for the area around your ears. Also comes with a nice pair of scissors, a small bottle of razor oil, and a plastic carrying case.<br />- Quality razor. It does not feel cheap or anything. I am not a professional barber but I do know that I do not get a feeling of lackluster material when I hold it.<br />- The blue area of the razor is a rubber grip that is useful while cutting.<br />- Does a great job of cutting hair. I use it mainly on my beard but I know that if this were used on hair it would have the same effect.<br /><br />Cons<br />- EXTREMELY loud. Louder than you would expect a razor to be. It sounds like a lawnmower motor in a razor's body. In addition to the loud noise, the vibrations are very noticeable too. This is not a dull buzz, this is a loud noise.<br />- While it does a very good job at cutting hair using the combs, the base razor without the combs is actually pretty lackluster.<br /><br />Conclusion<br /><br />I needed a razor that I could use mainly for my beard (and my hair when getting to a barber was not an option) and for the money I spent, this razor does a good job at filling those roles. Although it can be extremely loud, it does do a very nice job at cutting hair. Even my own personal barber made a comment on how good a deal this kit is for it's price. If you're looking to cut your own hair, or to start cutting others hair on the side, this is definitely a good place to start if you are not looking to break the bank for a professional razor.

Once the clippers slid out my hand to the sink which knocked out 3 of the teeth on the blades, which makes it cut unevenly.   2282. I wasn't paying close attention when I ordered this item, so I was surprised when it arrived that the \\"cleaning brush\\" included was so tiny. It's about 10 times smaller than the cleaning brush that was included with my last Wahl set. It's really more of a crevice tool, and it is virtually useless. Luckily, I hadn't gotten rod of my old set yet, so I just kept the old brush. It makes cleaning after a cut so much easier when you have a good brush with very long bristles that can clean inside, between the blades. My other complaint is the numbering system. They've color-coded this system by size, so they've sort of just given up on actually making the numbers on the actual plastic guards uniform or readable. Some of the numbers appear on one side, and some appear on the other. The ones that appear on the back side are tiny and difficult to read. You can see two examples in the photos I've uploaded above.

These are far better, work well to cut the hair, the color coded guides were a brilliant idea and make it easy to find the one you're looking for, and they give a good clean haircut. I can cut my own hair with no problem.<br /><br />I waited to use it 3 times before posting. I can't comment on longevity of the product but I can say I'm happy with this purchase. The color coding is a terrific idea and you don't have to keep the booklet as it's shown on the razor. I recommend cutting with a longer cut and working your way to the length you desire. I didn't. I just wanted it short.
  2424. This is a very good quality pair of cutters....especially for the inexpensive price. The color-coded guard attachments are nice, as well. Some cheap trimmers are not good (been there...done that). These will do the job for family use.
  2425. One of the best home clippers ever.

I do like the color coding system but that's the only good part of these clippers in my opinion. I purchased this at full price and my analysis is fair and impartial.

This helps hold the thumb in place and is very comfortable, but short beard hair sticks to it and is very hard to get off. Other than that small thing I really like this set of clippers.

Cut a long story short it is in a garbage bin. the positive is the attachments fit my old cutter. DO NOT BUY...

It doesn't seem to affect cutting but I have never figured out what causes it.<br />While this cutter is pretty much the same as most other cutters, the many color coded attachments along with the display on the cutter showing them all makes you feel very confident that your not going to mess things up. Just start with the larger attachments and work your way down until your happy with the look. That makes it very difficult to make a huge mistake cutting your hair.<br />If I had to buy again right now, I'd buy this same unit again.

Not only is shipping this product used wrong and unethical, it's disgusting and unsanitary, and possibly dangerous if the person before me had lice or other issues.<br /><br />When I looked at this item originally on Amazon, it had such overwhelmingly positive reviews, I didn't bother looking at the small minority of 1-stars, and I wish I had. It looks like I'm not the first person to have this problem. AMAZON - THIS IS INEXCUSABLE!! How can you continue to sell this item, and any items from this seller, after getting so many reports of this disgusting nature??<br /><br />I have emailed Amazon and asked them this question, and am awaiting response. I have been using Amazon heavily for years, and have never had something like this happen, but as far as I'm concerned, the fact that Amazon sees this happening and doesn't stop it is a BIG black eye for them in my eyes. 1-star for Wahl, whom I have also had previous good experiences with, and 1-star for Amazon for continuing to sell this item after repeated complaints!

  2559. This thing does exactly what it is supposed to do - exactly as it is supposed to do it. You can feel just how well made this product is and it is very quiet. A few days ago, I went to a barber recommended by the local paper. I got up from the chair when it was apparent that he didn't speak a word of English. I gave up, showed the white flag and ordered this in desperation.<br /><br />The first time I tried this reminded me of my first raw oyster. Both require a bit of courage. If you start with the longer guide combs, it is easy to then do some fine tuning with a shorter comb. The case it comes in is simplistic, and large enough to hold all the parts it comes with without issues. The razor itself is on the heavy side, but the weight feels good, and the razor clips that come with it are very well varied and work well. I would reccomend this product in a moment for anyone who wants to do their own haircuts from now on!
  2562. It can cut hair, and your scalp too, also required to wear earplugs when using this thing, insanely loud, gets hotter than hell only to burn your head, pulls hair out, just a flat out waste of money and time.
  2563. I have been cutting my own hair for over 23 years and have used Wahl and Norelco electric razors. I firmly think that if I simply keep this Wahl electric razor oiled it will likely last for another 20 years, easily. The colored size guards are VERY useful. I have clippers in one hand, a second mirror in the other and to make quick decisions on fading techniques or what size I want it is very easy.<br /><br />Highly recommend!
